statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: David Blanks scored 20, while Jose Rodriguez hit 4 of 7 from 3-point range and finished with 16 points to help Texas Southern beat Grambling State 79-72 Monday night.
article.headline: Fast start helps Texas Southern beat Grambling St. 79-72
article.linkText: Fast start helps Texas Southern beat Grambling St. 79-72
article.story: HOUSTON -- David Blanks scored 20, while Jose Rodriguez hit 4 of 7 from 3-point range and finished with 16 points to help Texas Southern beat Grambling State 79-72 Monday night. Chris Thomas and Malcolm Riley added 13 points apiece and Derrick Griffin scored 12 with 10 rebounds for Texas Southern. Texas Southern (12-12, 11-1 Southwestern Athletic Conference) shot 60 percent from the field, including 8 of 14 from 3-point range, in the first half and took a 46-16 lead into the break -- its highest-scoring first half this season. Grambling State scored 13 of the first 15 second-half points and a 3 pointer by Michael Bethea Jr. trimmed its deficit to 63-56 with 5:20 left, but it would get no closer. Ervin Mitchell led Grambling State with 23 points, eight rebounds and four assists. Mark Gray scored 13 and Bethea added 11, including three 3-pointers. Grambling State (6-19, 3-10) has lost eight in a row and 10 of its last 11.
